name: undoubtable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Something that is undoubtable is definitely true or definitely exists: The modernity of the ballet is undoubtable even if it was created in 1975. He enjoys showing off his undoubtable technical skills.
More examplesFewer examplesHis undoubtable talent-spotting skills mean that he should profit greatly from unsigned bands.It's undoubtable that city regeneration has succeeded because of the critical mass that the large city authorities have.It is undoubtable that his choice of characters and the pace of his discussion are very effective.With undoubtable East Coast strength, the firm has a large contingent of private equity specialists in New York, Philadelphia and Boston.
